title: Trump-Putin Talks Put Oil Markets on Edge
summary: The anticipated Trump-Putin meeting has become the dominant storyline in commodity markets this week, as traders and analysts weigh the chances of a sweeping geopolitical deal. August 8, 2025The Trump-Putin meeting has become the main commodity market news of this week, with...
fullContent: The anticipated Trump-Putin meeting has become the dominant storyline in commodity markets this week, as traders and analysts weigh the chances of a sweeping geopolitical deal. August 8, 2025The Trump-Putin meeting has become the main commodity market news of this week, with analysts speculating about the likelihood of a comprehensive deal and the impacts this could have on oil markets. ICE Brent has been gradually sliding closer to $65 per barrel as lower sanction risks on Russia could further erode the market’s in-built risk premium, however…

In this regard and pursuant to theprovisions of Regulation 47 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements)Regulations, 2015, we are enclosing herewith the extract of the Newspaper Advertisement dated08th August, 2025 published in the following newspapers:1. title: Supreme Court classifies telecom towers as movable property for GST, upholding Delhi HC ruling

title: Fed’s Musalem Says Inflation Still a Bigger Problem Than Jobs
summary: Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President Alberto Musalem said he supported last week’s decision by policymakers to leave interest rates steady, adding the US central bank is still missing more on the inflation side of its mandate.
fullContent: Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President Alberto Musalem said he supported last week’s decision by policymakers to leave interest rates steady, adding the US central bank is still missing more on the inflation side of its mandate.

title: One-time payments push up Equitas Small Finance Bank losses to ₹224 crore
summary: The loss was attributed to additional standard asset provision of ₹185 crore in microfinance and ₹145 crore for additional non-performing assets provision.
fullContent: The loss was attributed to additional standard asset provision of ₹185 crore in microfinance and ₹145 crore for additional non-performing assets provision

title: Trade Desk's stock drops 35%+ after the company's latest earnings and projections heightened concerns about its growth prospects amid Amazon's ad-tech threat (Ryan Vlastelica/Bloomberg)

fullContent: Ryan Vlastelica / Bloomberg: Trade Desk's stock drops 35%+ after the company's latest earnings and projections heightened concerns about its growth prospects amid Amazon's ad-tech threat — Trade Desk Inc. analysts are bailing on the one-time market favorite amid growing fears that its advertising technology will get steamrolled by Amazon.com Inc.'s offerings
